page.title: Taxonomies
page.reset-term-order: Reset terms list to alphabetical order

field.typeDescription: Taxonomies can be used on multiple Flarum resources. The type cannot be changed after creation. You can use identical names and slugs for taxonomies of different types.
field.name: => flamarkt-taxonomies.ref.field.name
field.showLabel: Show taxonomy label together with term
field.showLabelDescription: Display style for the discussion list and hero. Currently not used for other resource types.
field.enableFilterDescription: Allows deep-linking taxonomy filters to discussions, users and products for users with permission to "see all" of the taxonomy type. This also allows the same users to use the search filters with the REST API. Without "Show filters" setting, users don't have any obvious way to obtain those links for users and products. For discussions, the deep link can be found in the hero even if "Show filters" is disabled.
field.showFilterDescription: Show filters to regular visitors in the discussion list, user directory or shop index. Only works if "Enable filters" is enabled. Shop administrators can always filter by any taxonomy in the backoffice.
field.enableFulltextSearch: Index terms for full text search
field.enableFulltextSearchDescription: Only has an effect when the Scout integration is active. The term names will become part of the data available in fulltext search for regular users. The data will be available for search to any user with permission to list the resource ("View forum" for discussions, "Search users" for users and everyone for products), not the users who have the permission to see the taxonomy! You must manually re-build the Scout search index for the resource after changing this setting for existing taxonomies, same if you delete the taxonomy while terms are still assigned.
field.enableFulltextSearchWarning: Your permissions for searching the resource ("View forum" for discussions, "Search users" for users) are different from the Taxonomies "see all" permissions. Before enabling this option, make sure you are comfortable making the data searchable to those users even if they might normally not be able to see the taxonomies!
field.customValueSluggerDescription: Choose how you want the slug generated. If a slug already exists, a numeric prefix will automatically be appended. For the Transliterator option, you need to install and configure that other extension in advance.
field.countRequiredDescription: Enter the minimum and maximum number of terms from this taxonomy that may be applied to a resource.
field.tagScopeDescription: The taxonomy will only be available in the selected tags. If you select a single tag, the homepage filter will only be visible on that specific tag.

edit-taxonomy.deleteConfirmation: Do you really want to delete the taxonomy {name}? All terms under that taxonomy will be deleted. Discussions using the taxonomy will NOT be deleted.

edit-term.deleteConfirmation: Do you really want to delete the term {name}? Discussions using the term will NOT be deleted.
